questions.question: How many casual leaves can I take in a year?
questions.answer: Employees are entitled to 12 casual leave days per calendar year. Casual leave cannot be carried forward.

questions.question: What is the standard office timing?
questions.answer: Standard business hours are 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday, with a 1-hour lunch break.

questions.question: How do I apply for leave?
questions.answer: Submit a leave request through the HR portal at least 3 days in advance. Emergency leave should be informed to your manager as soon as possible.

questions.question: Am I eligible for maternity or paternity leave?
questions.answer: Maternity and paternity leave are provided as per applicable laws and company policy. Submit supporting documents via the HR portal.

questions.question: Is work from home allowed?
questions.answer: Remote work is permitted with prior approval from your manager and HR, subject to business needs and role eligibility.

questions.question: What is the dress code?
questions.answer: Business casual from Monday to Thursday. Casuals are allowed on Fridays. Formal attire is required for client meetings.

questions.question: How do I mark attendance when working remotely?
questions.answer: Mark attendance daily via the HRMS and remain reachable on official channels during core hours.

questions.question: What is the notice period for resignation?
questions.answer: The standard notice period is 30 days unless specified differently in your contract.

questions.question: How do I reset my domain password?
questions.answer: Use the Password Self-Service portal or contact the IT helpdesk. Ensure your new password meets complexity rules.

questions.question: Is personal USB storage allowed on office laptops?
questions.answer: Personal USB devices are restricted. Use encrypted, IT-approved media only with prior approval.

questions.question: How do I get VPN access?
questions.answer: Raise a request in the IT service portal. VPN is granted based on role and security clearance.

questions.question: What should I do if I suspect a phishing email?
questions.answer: Do not click links. Report the email via the 'Report Phishing' button or forward to the security team immediately.

questions.question: Are company emails monitored?
questions.answer: Yes. Email and internet usage may be monitored for security and compliance in accordance with company policy.

questions.question: Can I install software on my laptop?
questions.answer: Only IT-approved software from the company catalog may be installed. Raise a request for additional tools.

questions.question: How is data backed up?
questions.answer: Critical data is backed up to secure cloud storage as per the backup schedule. Store project files on approved drives.

questions.question: What is the policy on BYOD (Bring Your Own Device)?
questions.answer: BYOD is allowed only with MDM enrollment and adherence to security controls. Access is limited to approved apps.

questions.question: What personal data does the company collect?
questions.answer: We collect identification and employment data necessary for HR, payroll, security, and statutory compliance.

questions.question: How can I request access to my personal data?
questions.answer: Submit a Data Subject Access Request (DSAR) via the privacy portal or contact the Data Protection Officer.

questions.question: Do we share employee data with third parties?
questions.answer: Data may be shared with vetted processors (e.g., payroll, benefits) under contractual and legal safeguards.

questions.question: How long do we retain personal data?
questions.answer: Data is retained according to legal requirements and business needs, then securely deleted or anonymized.

questions.question: Can I withdraw consent for optional data processing?
questions.answer: Yes. You may withdraw consent at any time using the privacy portal. Core processing may rely on other legal bases.

questions.question: What is the procedure after a suspected data breach?
questions.answer: Report immediately to the security team. Incidents are logged, investigated, and notified per regulatory timelines.

questions.question: Is cross-border transfer of data allowed?
questions.answer: Cross-border transfers require appropriate safeguards such as SCCs or adequate jurisdiction approvals.

questions.question: Who is the Data Protection Officer (DPO)?
questions.answer: Contact details for the DPO are listed on the privacy portal and policy documents.

questions.question: What expenses are reimbursable during business travel?
questions.answer: Economy travel, local transport, business meals within limits, approved lodging, and work-related connectivity.

questions.question: How do I submit an expense claim?
questions.answer: Upload itemized receipts in the expense portal within 7 working days of return and route for manager approval.

questions.question: What items are non-reimbursable?
questions.answer: Alcohol, personal entertainment, minibar, fines, and any unapproved upgrades are not reimbursable.

questions.question: Are per-diems available for domestic travel?
questions.answer: Yes. Per-diem limits are defined by city class. Refer to the travel policy for current slabs.

questions.question: Can I claim ride-sharing receipts?
questions.answer: Yes, for business trips between approved locations. Attach digital receipts with date and route.

questions.question: How long does reimbursement take?
questions.answer: Approved claims are typically processed within 10 working days.

questions.question: What is the policy for international travel class?
questions.answer: Economy class is standard unless a business justification is pre-approved by management.

questions.question: Can I use a personal card for business expenses?
questions.answer: Yes, but claims must include original receipts. Corporate cards should be used where available.
